title: Textbooks and perfectly competitive labor market

content.question:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

The table provided represents the total quantity of textbooks that can be produced by a firm using different quantities of workers in a single day.

Number of Workers
 Total Quantity of Textbooks Produced per Day

<math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="37" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>37</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The workers are hired in a perfectly competitive labor market and are paid <math alttext="200 dollars" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>200</mn></math> per day, and these wages are the firm’s only variable cost. The firm also has a daily fixed cost of <math alttext="500 dollars" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>500</mn></math>. Every textbook is sold at a unit price of <math alttext="100 dollars" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>100</mn></math>.

(a) Calculate the average variable cost of producing <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> textbooks. Show your work.

(b) With the hiring of which worker do diminishing marginal returns begin for this firm? Explain using numbers.

(c) How many workers should this firm hire to maximize profits? Explain using marginal analysis.

(d) Calculate the firm’s economic profit if it hires the number of workers identified in part (c). Show your work.

(e) Assume the daily fixed cost increases to <math alttext="1,000 dollars" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$1,000</mtext></math>. What will happen to the profit-maximizing quantity of labor hired?
